outline.description: Front matter: title pages, preliminary pages, and contents
John Carter: An Assessment – the opening essay introducing Carter’s significance
Handlist of John Carter’s Published Writings
Carter’s Bibliographical Essays and Commentary – a series of essays on bibliographical research
Sources of the Sussex Declaration: A Reconsideration
Carter’s Continued Essays and Contributions – further bibliographical investigations and reflections
History of Pope’s Manuscripts – discussion of the provenance and analysis of Pope’s documentary materials
Extra-illustrations and Strawberry Hill Studies – case studies on extra-illustrated texts and Strawberry Hill
Appendix: Annotated proof copy and related drawings
Musical Tour of Mr. Dibdin – an account of Dibdin’s stage tour and its cultural context
Charlotte Brontë’s Manuscript of Shirley – study of stages in composition, revisions, and production of the fair-copy
The Brothers’ Comte de Gabalis – exploration of the text’s publication and design by a private press
Three Endings: Fitzgerald, Hemingway, Faulkner – recovery and discussion of alternative endings in American novels
Bibliographical Society and Concluding Information – society officers, benefactors, subscribing members, available publications, and program details
